pulltitle: Fixing a crash when removing a non-existant badge from a playlist.
pullsbody:
This addresses #731.

A crash was occurring when a user attempted to remove a badge from a playlist when that badge no longer existed in the playlist (or, conceivably, never did).  The most obvious way for this to happen that I could repro was having two browser windows open to the playlist page, and deleting the badge in both windows.

I initially treated this as an error condition and displayed an error to the user when this happened, but thought better of it and figured that they don't really need to know about it since the end result is what they want:  The badge is gone from their playlist.  I can change this behavior if desired, though.

There was also a second crash that occurred whenever any error at all was encountered on playlist delete request.  This has also been fixed.

pull_commit_message:
Middleware helper to support multiple API calls

Currently the 'middleware()' helper in the api module sets the result of an
API call to the 'req.remote' property. Effectively this allows a view to only
make one API call using the helper, because subsequent ones will clobber
whatever's in 'req.remote'.

This change extends the object, so long as the data objects returned from API
calls use different keys.

- `CSOL_AESTIMIA_SECRET` is the secret shared with Aestimia.

pulltitle: Add fake S3 storage for dev/testing/etc.
pullsbody:
This adds a fake S3 storage class that provides the very small subset of the Knox S3 API that CSOL-site uses. It stores all files locally on the filesystem.

This can be useful for development, testing, and deployment on tools like [fleeting](https://github.com/toolness/fleeting). It can also be useful as a way to document what subset of the S3 API we're using, so that it's easy to migrate away from AWS if we need to, or simply if we want to provide alternate back-ends in the future.

Tasks:
- [x] Add fake S3 implementation with tests.
- [x] Make `s3.js` use the fake S3 implementation if an environment variable is defined.
- [x] Document the environment variable in the README.

CSOL_MANDRILL_KEY is the only required piece of configuration.
Additionally, setting DEBUG and CSOL_DISABLE_EMAIL in the env
will cause the module to log instead of posting to the Mandrill
API. Template names can be configured in the module itself.
The module exports one method: send(template, context, recipients, callback)

pull_commit_message:
Adding a module to send emails through Mandrill.
CSOL_MANDRILL_KEY is the only required piece of configuration.
Additionally, setting DEBUG and CSOL_DISABLE_EMAIL in the env
will cause the module to log instead of posting to the Mandrill
API. Template names can be configured in the module itself.
The module exports one method: send(template, context, recipients, callback)

pull_commit_message:
This changes openbadger.js and api.js such that openbadger now
uses api, and the app only has to use openbadger. api(openbadger.x)
calls now look like openbadger.middleware('x'), and otherwise
the same methods are exposed on the openbadger object.

Note that this means api.js has a new usage as well. If you create
a new api, e.g.
  var api = new Api('ORIGIN');
you will have an object with all the get/post/head/etc. helpers
that could also be used if you want to fetch data from an API
without the layer of abstraction that providing additional functions
gives. This usage isn't well tested.

pullsbody:
I'm not entirely sure what cleartype fixing for IE is, but
I noticed that when I removed the call to `$.cycle`, the problem went away,
and then I noticed there was an option in the plugin described as follows:

> set to true to disable extra cleartype fixing (leave false to force
> background color setting on slides)

That seemed like it could be promising, so I changed the value and
things worked. I'm still not entirely sure _why_ they work because I
don't know what cleartype fixing is, but it appears to only apply to IE,
and other browsers don't break when this setting is changed, so it looks
like a decent fix.
